intro: Selinon carvifolia, commonly known as narrow-leaved celery, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, hollow stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that resemble those of celery. Its flowers are small, white to greenish-yellow, and arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Selinon carvifolia is often found in moist, shaded areas and has a mild, aromatic scent.
